note: P. Migne reproduced Bongar’s edition for volume 166 of the Patrologia Latina (1854). 16 BD 10.
title: The 1611 edition in the collection of Jacques Bongars was based upon

MS Latin 5513. This manuscript has been the subject of a study by N. L. Paul, who concluded that it was an untypical version of the Historia Hierosolymitana ‘redacted to suit the political and commemorative imperatives of the seigneurial family of Amboise’

An edition of the Historia Iherosolimitana appeared as early at 1492 in Cologne; it was printed in Basle in 1533 and Frankfurt-am-Main in 1584. It was included in Jacques Bongars’ important 1611 collection of crusading accounts Gesta Dei per Francos (Hanover, 1611) and was printed in the Patrologia Latina series in 1844 by J
